page.title: 15HOUSING
page.content: The area covered by our survey is largely rural, with most of the land being used for crops and grassland for the dairy herds. Recently there has been some development of housing in the area especially to the west as this part lies almost next to the town of St Helier. During the 1930's many new estates were built. A typical example of this is Langley Park. Langley Park is a road with detached houses and bungalows either side. These houses, many with bay windows, were built of pressed blocks using granite chippings to give a rough texture. In the early 1960's in an attempt to clear the slum areas of St Helier a number of high density estates, which included 3 and 5 storey flats, were built.
